Package com.visionspace.taskmanager.impl.store

Class InMemoryTaskStore

java.lang.Object
com.visionspace.taskmanager.impl.store.InMemoryTaskStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
TaskStore, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class InMemoryTaskStore
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaskStore
Implementation of a TaskStore in memory. Task state is not persisted in external storage, and therefore this implementation is not suitable for a distributed task manager. It also doesn't allow for task manager restarts where a restarted task manager picks tasks scheduled by a previous one.

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addTaskListener​(TaskChangeListener listener)
    Adds a TaskChangeListener to the current store.
    void cancelTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Makes the state change for when a task is cancelled, i.e., state changes to TaskState.FAILED and TaskStateInfo.wasCancelled() set to true.
    boolean claimTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Claims a task in an atomic operation, changing the task from the TaskState.QUEUED state to the TaskState.RUNNING state if the claim operation succeeds.
    void close()
    Releases resources used by the task store.

    Creates a task.
    void failTask​(java.lang.String taskId, java.lang.Exception error)
    Makes the state change for when a task finishes with error, i.e., state changes to TaskState.FAILED and TaskStateInfo.wasCancelled() set to false.
    TaskHandle getTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Gets the handles for a given task.

    Gets handles for all the tasks in the store.
    void removeTaskListener​(TaskChangeListener listener)
    Removes an existing TaskChangeListener of the current store.
    void succeedTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
    Makes the state change for when a task finishes successfully, i.e., state changes to TaskState.SUCCESS.

    • claimTask

      public boolean claimTask​(java.lang.String taskId)
      Description copied from interface: TaskStore
      Claims a task in an atomic operation, changing the task from the TaskState.QUEUED state to the TaskState.RUNNING state if the claim operation succeeds. In case of concurrent claim operations, only one of them succeeds.
      Specified by:
      claimTask in interface TaskStore
      Parameters:
      taskId - The task to claim.
      Returns:
      true if the task was claimed, false otherwise.
